title: Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Amendments
description: Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Amendments

history.action: Bill Numbered but not Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
Numbered Bill Publicly Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
House/ received bill from Legislative Research in Clerk of the House
House/ 1st reading (Introduced) in House Rules Committee

general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to law enforcement and criminal justice.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the Office of State Debt Collection has the authority to collect civil accounts receivable or a civil judgment of restitution and interest thereon;<hr><ltbullet>provides that administrative garnishments also apply to a debtor's property or wages that are under control of a third party;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Office of State Debt Collection to provide an accounting of the unpaid balance of a defendant's criminal accounts receivable at the time of termination of the defendant's sentence;<hr><ltbullet>provides repayment procedures for any unpaid balance of a defendant's criminal accounts receivable upon termination of a sentence;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a pretrial hearing constitutes a material change in circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>removes references to unsecured bonds;<hr><ltbullet>adds requirements for temporary pretrial status orders of detention;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a request for a pretrial release at an initial appearance does not constitute a pretrial detention hearing;<hr><ltbullet>requires a court to make findings of fact when making a determination regarding pretrial release;<hr><ltbullet>adds a financial condition schedule to aid a court in determining the amount of a fixed financial condition;<hr><ltbullet>requires a prosecuting attorney to include in a motion for pretrial detention any known information that is favorable to the individual that is the subject of the motion;<hr><ltbullet>requires the release of or a financial condition to be fixed for an individual if a pretrial detention hearing is not held within 21 days of the individual's first appearance;<hr><ltbullet>requires that evidence in a pretrial detention hearing shall not be made by proffer, unless otherwise agreed on the record;<hr><ltbullet>provides for required procedures when a no bail hold is requested; <hr><ltbullet>provides that certain Board of Pardons and Parole decisions on restitution are final and not subject to judicial review;<hr><ltbullet>codifies order of restitution procedures that apply to certain offenders sentenced before July 1, 2021;<hr><ltbullet>provides procedures accounting and payment of restitution owed to various state governmental entities;<hr><ltbullet>permits a sentencing court to authorize the deposit of funds in certain interest-bearing accounts when distribution to a victim is pending;<hr><ltbullet>permits the Board of Pardons and Parole to order recovery of fees incurred on behalf of a sentenced offender in addition to the existing ability to recover costs;<hr><ltbullet>makes coordinating modifications related to docket entry and interest assessments;<hr><ltbullet>permits a court to set restitution for a juvenile sentenced to prison;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the duties of the Utah Indigent Defense Commission and the Office of Indigent Defense Services;<hr><ltbullet>extends the date of the verification of indigency pilot program;<hr><ltbullet>modifies duties and reporting requirements related to the verification of indigency pilot program;<hr><ltbullet>modifies procedures to permit a prosecuting attorney to make a motion to request that a court require a minor convicted of aggravated murder to be housed in a prison or jail, rather than in a juvenile secure care facility; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and grammatical changes.
